meanings.sent1: The dog rolled in something cacky and needed a bath.
meanings.sent2: The cacky walls of the old house needed a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent3: The prankster left a cacky surprise on the doorstep.
meanings.sent4: Her shoes were so cacky, they looked like they had been dipped in mud.
meanings.sent5: The cacky smell in the room made everyone hold their noses.

meanings.sent1: The toy car broke easily because it was cacky.
meanings.sent2: The cacky movie had terrible acting and a weak plot.
meanings.sent3: He tried to sell me a cacky watch that stopped working after a day.
meanings.sent4: The cacky imitation jewelry turned her skin green.
meanings.sent5: The cacky taste of the food made her regret ordering it.

meanings.sent1: Don't listen to his cacky, he's just making things up.
meanings.sent2: She ignored the cacky and focused on the important information.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's cacky had the audience laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: His cacky was like a never-ending stream of silly stories.
meanings.sent5: The teacher dismissed the student's cacky and redirected the discussion.
